teamstoolkit.accountTree.azureAccountToo:
AZURE ACCOUNT  
The Teams Toolkit may require an Azure subscription to deploy the Azure resources for your project.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.m365AccountTool:
M365 ACCOUNT  
The Teams Toolkit requires an Microsoft 365 organizational account where Teams is running and has been registered.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.noSubscriptions: You have no subscriptions. You can't provision or deploy your resources to Azure!
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingMess: [Teams Toolkit] Your Microsoft 365 tenant admin hasn't enabled sideloading permission for your account. You can't install your app to Teams! Please applying for a Microsoft 365 developer tenant by joining Microsoft developer program or contact your tenant admin to resolve the issue.
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingPass: You have sideloading permission already. You're good to install your app to Teams!
teamstoolkit.accountTree.sideloadingWarn: Your M365 tenant admin hasn't enabled sideloading permission for your account. You can't install your app to Teams!
teamstoolkit.appStudioLogin.loginCancel: Sign in canceled. The Teams Toolkit requires a Microsoft 365 organizational account where Teams is running and has been registered.
teamstoolkit.appStudioLogin.message: The Teams Toolkit requires a Microsoft 365 organizational account where Teams is running and has been registered. You can create a free testing account from M365 Developer Program if needed.
teamstoolkit.azureLogin.message: The Teams Toolkit requires an Azure account and subscription to deploy the Azure resources for your project. You will not be charged without further confirmation.
teamstoolkit.azureLogin.unknownSubscript: Cannot set subscription. Select a subscription that you have access to.
teamstoolkit.codeFlowLogin.loginCodeFlow: Cannot get login code for token exchange. Login with another account.

teamstoolkit.codeFlowLogin.loginTimeoutD: Timeout waiting for login. Try again.

teamstoolkit.graphLogin.warningMsg: The Teams Toolkit requires a Microsoft 365 account. This is the account that you use to log in to Microsoft Teams. The Teams Toolkit will use this account to manage applications and service principals.
teamstoolkit.handlers.automaticNpmInstal: Teams Toolkit will automatically install packages required for your project. Please refer to the command window prompt to view execution details. You can also disable this by clicking the button below and uncheck "Automatic NPM Install" in the settings page.
teamstoolkit.handlers.azureSignIn: Successfully signed in to Azure account.
teamstoolkit.handlers.azureSignOut: Successfully signed out of Azure account.
teamstoolkit.handlers.concurrentTriggerT: Task '%s' is still running. Wait for it to complete before starting another task.
teamstoolkit.handlers.createProjectNotif: You should create a new Teams app or open an existing one to open the README file.
teamstoolkit.handlers.grantPermissionSuc: Added account: '%s' to the environment '%s' as the Teams app owner.
teamstoolkit.handlers.grantPermissionWar: If added user cannot access Azure resources, you need to manually setup access policy via Azure portal.

teamstoolkit.handlers.invalidProject: Failed to debug Teams App. The project is not a valid Teams project.

teamstoolkit.handlers.resourceInfoNotFou: Can not load %s info for environment %s.

teamstoolkit.localDebug.installApp.descr: To continue debug your application in Outlook, you need to install the app via Teams first.
teamstoolkit.localDebug.installApp.detec: We detected that you have not yet installed the app in Teams first, please make sure the app is installed.
teamstoolkit.localDebug.installApp.guide: Clicking "Install in Teams" will pop up Teams Web Client for you to install app. Once you have finished, please come back and click "Continue".
teamstoolkit.localDebug.npmInstallFailed: Task '%s' failed. Please refer to the '%s' terminal window for detailed error information or click 'Report Issue' button to report the issue.
